channel.title: Comments on: R Function to write model output to a file
channel.description: Research focused on biogeography, spatial ecology and landscape change at Kent State University

item.title: By: tim.assal@gmail.com
item.dc:creator: tim.assal@gmail.com
item.description:
Thanks for the information Antonio.
I figured there was something like this out there, but apparently I did not look hard enough!
Hope you're doing well!
Abrazos, Tim
item.content:encoded:
Thanks for the information Antonio.

I figured there was something like this out there, but apparently I did not look hard enough!

Hope you’re doing well!

Abrazos,
Tim

item.title: By: Antonio J.
item.dc:creator: Antonio J.
item.description:
Hi Tim,
Thanks for this useful function. It looks like simple but it's very useful to get results from models. Specifically, it'll be useful if you're running a lot of models or you have a loop and you need to save the outputs.
For your example it could be also useful to include a function from broom package (https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/broom/index.html) which returns the model's parameters like a paper table. The function is <em>tidy</em>. I hope this can be useful.
Thanks for the function. Hugs.
item.content:encoded:
Hi Tim,

Thanks for this useful function. It looks like simple but it’s very useful to get results from models. Specifically, it’ll be useful if you’re running a lot of models or you have a loop and you need to save the outputs.

For your example it could be also useful to include a function from broom package (https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/broom/index.html) which returns the model’s parameters like a paper table. The function is tidy. I hope this can be useful.

Thanks for the function.
Hugs.
